docs.abstract: Why Uruguay? U.S.-based entrepreneur Steve Bowman and his wife, Chris, looked in Panama and researched other tropical locales before they bought property in Piriapolis, Uruguay's old resort town, 18 months ago. Their reasons for choosing Uruguay included the country's stability and relatively unspoiled coastline, as well as the friendly people. They were also enticed by [...]

headline.main: American couple picks Uruguay for their property investment

docs.snippet: Ryan Harrison, 15, beat Pablo Cuevas of Uruguay, 6-4, 6-3, in the United States Clay Court Championship in Houston to become the 10th player in the Open era to win a main-draw match before his 16th birthday. Harrison, a Texan, is the youngest player...
docs.lead_paragraph: Ryan Harrison, 15, beat Pablo Cuevas of Uruguay, 6-4, 6-3, in the United States Clay Court Championship in Houston to become the 10th player in the Open era to win a main-draw match before his 16th birthday. Harrison, a Texan, is the youngest player to get a main-draw win on the ATP Tour since Rafael Nadal, the current No. 2 in the world, won his first tour match in Mallorca, Spain, in 2002. Harrison is the third player this decade to do it before turning 16.

docs.snippet: ASHLEY--Carleton, 89, died peacefully, April 26 in Scarborough, ME. He is survived by his devoted wife of 65 years, Marilyn, three children, C. Allen (Anne), Frances (Paul Rubacha), and Julia Lynn (Phil Hocking), and five grandchildren, Teryn,...
docs.lead_paragraph: ASHLEY--Carleton, 89, died peacefully, April 26 in Scarborough, ME. He is survived by his devoted wife of 65 years, Marilyn, three children, C. Allen (Anne), Frances (Paul Rubacha), and Julia Lynn (Phil Hocking), and five grandchildren, Teryn, Carleton, Ali, Chris, and Elizabeth. Born in Bronxville, NY, ''Ash'' was a graduate of Berkshire School (1937) and Yale University (1941), a member of Saybrook College, Delta Kappa Epsilon Fraternity, and Scroll and Key. He spent five years in the U.S. Army as a Major in the Military Intelligence Service, Latin American. He enjoyed a successful career in international business with executive positions at Coca-Cola Export Corp, E.R. Squibb & Sons, and Carter Wallace Inc. retiring as President, Carter-Wallace International. He lived for many years in Bronxville, NY, Princeton, NJ, and Castine, ME, as well as Uruguay, Argentina, Philippines, Spain and France. He was an avid outdoorsman, athlete, cook, sports fan, polyglot, and history buff. A Memorial Service will be held at a later date. Contributions may be made in his name to the Castine Historical Society, 17 School St., Castine, ME 04412.
